intro: Thibaudia retusa, commonly known as the slender thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Thibaudia retusa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
